intro: Chlamysporum, commonly known as the "false broomrape," is a parasitic plant belonging to the Orobanchaceae family. It lacks chlorophyll and cannot perform photosynthesis, relying entirely on its host for nutrients. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers and has a root system that attaches to the roots of its host plant. It is typically found in areas with dry, disturbed soils, often parasitizing grasses and other herbaceous plants. Due to its lack of visible above-ground structures, it is often overlooked in ecological studies.
